design_audit.notes: Household-level RCT with municipality stratification. Rainfall is natural variation (non-experimental). Stacking pools 2012 and 2013 cross-sections with year FE.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Request any private good from politician (binary, stacked 2012-2013; ask_private_stacked)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Cisterns treatment (randomized household-level infrastructure program) AND rainfall shocks (standardized annual rainfall deviation)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Joint ITT effects of cisterns treatment and rainfall vulnerability shocks on clientelist requests for private goods, with municipality FE and year FE
claim_object.target_population: Individuals in semi-arid municipalities of northeastern Brazil enrolled in cistern program

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col3
baseline_specs.controls_description: Municipality FE + year indicator. No individual-level controls.
baseline_specs.notes: Table 3 Col 3: joint specification with both treatment and rainfall, no interaction.

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col4
baseline_specs.controls_description: Municipality FE + year indicator + treatment x rainfall interaction.
baseline_specs.notes: Table 3 Col 4: adds cisterns x rainfall interaction. Extends Col 3 baseline.

constraints.notes: Minimum: no controls beyond treatment (bivariate). Maximum: municipality FE + year FE + engagement controls with treatment/rainfall interactions (Appendix Table A7, Col 4 adds 9 additional regressors as 3 bundles of level+treat_interaction+rain_interaction). The paper's main specs use only municipality FE and year indicator. Engagement controls must be added as level+interaction bundles (not componentwise).

explore_universe.notes: ask_public (public goods requests) is a placebo/diagnostic outcome, not the same claim object. askrec_private (request AND receive) changes the outcome concept. Table 5 heterogeneity by clientelist relationship changes the estimand to CHET. Household-level aggregation changes the population concept.

canonical.notes: Matches the paper's baseline: cluster at the neighborhood level (b_clusters). This is coarser than household (randomization unit) but accounts for spatial correlation.

variants.notes: Cluster at municipality level (coarser, few clusters ~10).

sampling.notes: Full enumeration of planned specs. 2 baselines + 1 design + 7 control sets + 5 treatment forms + 2 year splits + 1 outcome form + 2 FE variants + 1 outlier trim = ~21 core specs.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table A2: balance table for individual and household baseline characteristics across treatment/control.
Table A1: compliance rates and attrition differential by treatment.
Table 3 Col 8: public goods requests as placebo (should show no treatment effect if mechanism is clientelist-specific).
Table A6: clientelism marker (frequent_interactor) is uncorrelated with treatment assignment.

treatment_arms: tot_treat_by_section_2 (share of treated in voting section)
tot_study_2 (share of study participants in voting section)
fe_structure: location_id (voting location FE, absorbed via reghdfe)
design_audit.notes: Electoral outcomes are at the voting-section level, not individual level. Treatment is rescaled as share of treated individuals in each voting section. This is an ecological inference design bridging household randomization to aggregate electoral outcomes.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Votes for incumbent mayor in 2012 election (section-level; incumbent_votes_section)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Share of cistern-treated individuals in voting section (rescaled from household-level randomization)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of cistern treatment exposure on electoral support for incumbent mayor, in municipalities where the incumbent ran for re-election
claim_object.target_population: Voting sections in 21 municipalities where the incumbent mayor ran for re-election in 2012

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Col1
baseline_specs.controls_description: Voting location FE (absorbed) + eligible voters control + total study respondents. Rescaled regressors.
baseline_specs.sample_filter: name_match == 1 & eligible_in_2008 != . (21 municipalities where incumbent mayor ran for re-election)
baseline_specs.notes: Wild-cluster bootstrap at municipality level also reported for p-values.

constraints.notes: Very constrained specification. Location FE + eligible voters + study respondent share. Main variation is in sample definition (21 vs 39 municipalities).

explore_universe.notes: Alternative electoral outcomes (Table 4 Cols 3-5, Table A8) change the outcome concept from incumbent votes. Table A8 Col 1 decomposes by clientelist relationship, changing the estimand.

canonical.notes: Matches the paper's baseline: cluster at the voting location level.

variants.notes: Wild-cluster bootstrap at municipality level (as in paper). Few clusters (~21).

sampling.notes: Full enumeration. 1 baseline + 1 design + 1 sample variant + 2 control drops + 1 FE variant = ~6 core specs.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table A3: balance across voting sections in voters' age, schooling, gender.
